para.dtcname: Engine Coolant Temperature Circuit Range / Performance Problem

data-name.name: detect-item
data-name.ptxt: Engine Coolant Temperature Circuit Range / Performance Problem

data-name.name: dtc-detect-cond
data-name.ptxt: The Engine Coolant Temperature (ECT) is between 35°C and 60°C (95°F and 140°F) when the engine is started, and conditions (a) and (b) are met (2 trip detection logic):

item.ptxt: (a) The vehicle is driven at varying speeds (accelerated and decelerated).
(b) The ECT remains within 3°C (5.4°F) of the initial ECT.

content5.ptxt: The ECT sensor is used to monitor the ECT. The ECT sensor has a built-in thermistor with a resistance that varies according to the temperature of the engine coolant. When the ECT is low, the resistance of the thermistor increases. When the temperature is high, the resistance drops. These variations in the resistance are reflected in the output voltage from the ECT sensor.

The ECM monitors the sensor voltage and uses this value to calculate the ECT. If the sensor output voltage deviates from the normal operating range, the ECM interprets this deviation as a malfunction in the ECT sensor and stores the DTC.

Upon starting the engine, the ECT is between 35°C and 60°C (95°F and 140°F). If after driving for 250 seconds, the ECT remains within 3°C (5.4°F) of the starting temperature, the DTC is stored (2 trip detection logic).

item.ptxt: If any of DTCs P0115, P0117 or P0118 are stored simultaneously with DTC P0116, the ECT sensor may have an open or a short circuit. Troubleshoot those DTCs first.

Read freeze frame data using the GTS. Freeze frame data records the engine condition when malfunctions are detected. When troubleshooting, freeze frame data can help determine if the vehicle was moving or stationary, if the engine was warmed up or not, if the air fuel ratio was lean or rich, and other data from the time the malfunction occurred.

testgrp.testtitle: CHECK ANY OTHER DTCS OUTPUT (IN ADDITION TO DTC P0116)

test1.ptxt: Connect the GTS to the DLC3.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Enter the following menus: Powertrain / Engine and ECT / Trouble Codes.

gts-info.title: Powertrain > Engine and ECT > Trouble Codes

entry.ptxt: DTC P0116 and other DTCs are output

atten4.ptxt: If any DTCs other than P0116 are output, troubleshoot those DTCs first.

testgrp.testtitle: INSPECT WATER INLET WITH THERMOSTAT SUB-ASSEMBLY

test1.ptxt: Inspect the water inlet with thermostat sub-assembly (thermostat opening temperature).

action.actiontitle: REPLACE WATER INLET WITH THERMOSTAT SUB-ASSEMBLY
